6600.name: The North Road - Midgaard Outskirts
6600.description:
The cobblestones of Midgaard give way to a packed-dirt road heading north
into dense forest. A weathered signpost stands at the junction, its arms
pointing in several directions. The city walls loom behind you to the south,
offering a last glimpse of civilization before the wilderness swallows the path.

south.description: The road leads back toward Midgaard.

north.description: The road plunges into the forest.

extra_descs.signpost sign:
The signpost reads:
  NORTH - The Northern Wilderness
  NORTHWEST - Goblin Warrens (DANGER)
  EAST - The Eastern Highlands
  SOUTH - Midgaard

6601.name: A Forest Road
6601.description:
Tall oaks and elms form a canopy overhead, dappling the road with shifting
patches of sunlight. Birds call from the branches, and the undergrowth
rustles with small creatures. The road is well-worn but narrow, with
wagon ruts cutting deep into the soft earth.

south.description: The road leads south toward Midgaard.

east.description: A rocky trail branches east toward the highlands.

6602.name: A Forest Clearing
6602.description:
The trees pull back from the road here, creating a broad clearing carpeted
with wildflowers and clover. A ring of stones marks an old campfire, and
several logs have been dragged around it for seating. This looks like a
regular rest stop for travelers and merchants.

north.description: The road continues into deeper forest.

west.description: A faint trail leads west into the trees.

extra_descs.campfire stones ring: The ashes are cold but recent. Someone camped here within the last few days.

6603.name: Deep Forest Road
6603.description:
The forest grows ancient here. Massive trees tower overhead, their trunks
wide enough for two people to hide behind. Moss drapes from every branch,
and the air is thick with the smell of loam and decay. The road narrows
to little more than a footpath, barely visible beneath fallen leaves.

north.description: The path descends toward the sound of water.

6604.name: The River Crossing
6604.description:
A broad, shallow river cuts across the path here. Flat stones have been
laid across the riverbed to form a crude ford, though water still swirls
ankle-deep over them. The current is gentle but persistent, carrying
autumn leaves downstream. Fish dart between the rocks in the clear water.

south.description: The forest path climbs away from the river.

north.description: The path continues on the far bank.

6605.name: Northern Forest - Fork in the Road
6605.description:
Beyond the river, the forest thins slightly and the path splits. To the
northwest, the trail grows rougher and climbs into rocky hills — a crude
sign scratched on a tree reads 'GOBLINS' with an arrow. To the northeast,
the path follows the river upstream through birch groves.

south.description: The path leads back to the river crossing.

west.description: A rough trail climbs toward goblin territory.

north.description: A birch-lined path follows the river.

6606.name: Rocky Hill Trail
6606.description:
The trail steepens sharply as it climbs through increasingly sparse
forest into rocky terrain. Goblin tracks are visible in the mud —
small, clawed footprints in groups of three or four. The trees give
way to scrubby bushes and exposed boulders. A foul smell drifts
from somewhere ahead.

east.description: The trail descends back to the forest fork.

north.description: The trail continues toward a dark hillside.

6607.name: Outside the Goblin Warrens
6607.description:
The trail ends at a jagged crack in a barren hillside. Crude totems of
bone and feather flank the dark opening, and the stench of goblin
habitation is unmistakable. Scratch marks and old bloodstains mark the
rocks around the entrance. The forest lies safely to the south.

south.description: The trail leads back through rocky hills.

north.description: The dark crack leads into the Goblin Warrens.

6608.name: A Shaded Grove
6608.description:
A quiet grove of ancient willows, their trailing branches forming a
natural curtain around a small mossy clearing. Mushrooms grow in fairy
rings around the bases of the trees, and the air hums with insects.
This place feels peaceful — almost unnaturally so.

east.description: A faint trail leads back to the clearing.

6609.name: Birch Grove Along the River
6609.description:
Slender white birch trees line both banks of the river here, their papery
bark peeling in curls. The water babbles over smooth stones, and shafts
of golden light filter through the canopy. A family of deer watches you
warily from the far bank before bounding away.

south.description: The path returns to the forest fork.

6610.name: The Old Stone Bridge
6610.description:
An ancient stone bridge arches over the river, its surface worn smooth by
countless feet over centuries. Moss fills the cracks between the stones,
and carved faces — worn nearly featureless by time — peer out from the
bridgework. A merchant's cart lies overturned nearby, its contents long
since looted.

south.description: The birch-lined path follows the river south.

north.description: The road continues into the northern reaches.

6611.name: The Mountain Pass Approach
6611.description:
The forest falls away entirely here as the road begins climbing into
barren foothills. Wind whips across exposed rock, and the temperature
drops noticeably. Snow dusts the highest peaks visible to the north.
A weathered signpost leans drunkenly at the trailside.

south.description: The road descends back toward the forest.

extra_descs.signpost sign: Barely legible: 'Mountain Pass - Proceed with caution. Bandits reported.'

6612.name: The Mountain Pass
6612.description:
A narrow pass cuts between two towering peaks, the walls of stone rising
sheer on either side. The wind howls through this natural corridor,
carrying flurries of snow. Rocky outcroppings provide perfect ambush
points, and you notice boot prints in the thin layer of frost — several
sets, all recent.

north.description: The pass opens to a vista beyond.

6613.name: Northern Vista
6613.description:
The pass opens onto a breathtaking vista of the northern lands. Rolling
hills stretch to the horizon, dark with pine forests and cut by silver
rivers. Far to the northeast, a dark structure perches on a distant
hilltop — perhaps a monastery of some kind. The wilderness spreads in
every direction, wild and untamed.

6600.name: timber wolf
6600.long_desc: A large timber wolf prowls through the undergrowth, watching you with yellow eyes.
6600.description:
This wolf is lean and powerful, with thick grey fur and intelligent yellow
eyes. It moves with the easy confidence of a predator in its own territory.

6601.name: black bear
6601.long_desc: A large black bear lumbers through the forest, sniffing the air.
6601.description:
This bear is massive, easily weighing several hundred pounds. Its thick
black fur is matted with burrs and its claws are as long as daggers.

6602.name: forest bandit
6602.long_desc: A rough-looking bandit lurks in the shadows, hand on sword.
6602.description:
This bandit wears mismatched leather armor and a dark cloak. A jagged
scar runs across one cheek, and his eyes dart nervously, sizing you up.

6603.name: bandit captain
6603.long_desc: A scarred bandit captain surveys his territory with cold eyes.
6603.description:
The captain of the forest bandits is a battle-hardened warrior wearing
well-maintained chainmail beneath his forest-green cloak. He carries a
fine longsword that was clearly stolen from someone of means.

6604.name: traveling merchant
6604.long_desc: A stout merchant rests by the roadside, guarding his pack.
6604.description:
This cheerful merchant carries an enormous pack stuffed with goods. He
seems to know these roads well and is happy to share directions with
travelers — for the price of a friendly ear.

6605.name: young deer
6605.long_desc: A young deer grazes peacefully among the wildflowers.
6605.description: A graceful young deer with soft brown eyes and spotted flanks.

6600.name: wolf pelt
6600.description: A thick grey wolf pelt, soft and well-furred.
